segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and it’s like no one notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, she might as well be in another world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like it’s a tightrope act.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, expecting a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be a slippery mess soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and it’s just going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re going to get in trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing’s wrong inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a disaster waiting to happen, and no one’s doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
